notes: Fifth generation midsize sedan on GM A-platform (downsized). Introduced as part of GM's 1973 downsizing. Multiple V6/V8 engine options. RWD only. Platform shared with Chevrolet Malibu, Pontiac LeMans, Oldsmobile Cutlass. Standard service complexity for 1970s midsize RWD sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Century article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First generation Regal introduced as upscale Century trim, became standalone model 1973. GM A-platform. Multiple V6/V8 engines. 2-door coupe only. RWD. Replaced Skylark GS nameplate. Standard service complexity for 1970s midsize RWD coupe. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Regal article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Subcompact on GM H-platform shared with Chevrolet Monza, Pontiac Sunbird, Oldsmobile Starfire. Initially 2.3L inline-4 (Vega engine), optional 3.8L V6 added 1978. RWD only. Hatchback and notchback body styles. First Buick with 4-cylinder engine since 1930s. Standard service complexity for 1970s subcompact. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Skyhawk article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Compact sedan on GM X-platform shared with Chevrolet Nova, Pontiac Ventura, Oldsmobile Omega. Badge-engineered Nova variant. Base inline-6 or optional V8 engines. RWD only. Replaced by Skylark for 1975. Short production run 1973-1975. Standard service complexity for 1970s compact RWD sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Apollo article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Fifth generation full-size sedan, dramatically downsized for 1977 on GM C-platform (RWD). Base 3.8L V6, optional 5.0L V8 or 5.7L Oldsmobile diesel V8. Remained RWD until 1985 FWD redesign. Coupe and sedan body styles. Standard service complexity for 1970s-1980s downsized full-size sedan; Oldsmobile diesel optional. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Electra article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Sixth generation full-size sedan, downsized for 1977 on GM B-platform (RWD). Base 3.8L V6, optional 5.0L V8 or 4.3L diesel V8. Remained RWD until 1985 FWD redesign. Coupe and sedan body styles. Platform shared with Chevrolet Impala/Caprice. Standard service complexity for 1970s-1980s downsized full-size sedan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick LeSabre article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Full-size luxury station wagon spanning multiple B-body platforms (1970-1990). Initially large pre-downsizing body, downsized 1977, remained RWD throughout production. Various V6/V8 engines through the decades. Wood-grain exterior trim (Di-Noc). Last full-size RWD Buick wagon. Discontinued 1990. Standard service complexity for full-size RWD wagon. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Estate Wagon article, December 19, 2024 revision.
